project.teaser: DEMETRA will demonstrate means to alleviate tensions between democratic governance and climate and sustainability transitions through an analysis of new deliberative participatory processes (DPPs) such as citizens’ assemblies and e-governance. These bottom-up processes can...
project.objective: DEMETRA will demonstrate means to alleviate tensions between democratic governance and climate and sustainability transitions through an analysis of new deliberative participatory processes (DPPs) such as citizens’ assemblies and e-governance. These bottom-up processes can be highly inclusive allowing to afford a genuine political voice to all segments of society. Accordingly, gender and intersectional aspects (e.g., socioeconomic background, ethnicity) will be focused on throughout the project in particular with regard to citizen participation. DEMETRA analyzes the micro-, meso-, and macro-level opportunities for DPPs across Europe supporting the transition towards a more sustainable future; focuses in particular the transformation towards a more sustainable food system as a crucial case study; systematically compares DPPs’ setup, processes, and outcomes to identify best practices that contribute to citizens’ democratic engagement and the co-construction of sustainable societies; identifies DPPs that maximize inclusiveness and empowerment across social groups, particularly those at the margins of society; and identifies widely applicable solutions to engage in the transformation toward sustainable food systems. DEMETRA builds on a multidimensional approach that combines macro- (institutional), meso- (organizational), and micro-level (individual) explanatory factors; a cross-national comparative design that includes European countries with different DPPs experience and different food systems (Estonia, France, Germany, Italy, Sweden, Switzerland, and UK); and an integrated methodological approach based on multiple sources and methods (including population surveys, organizational survey, semi-structured interviews, participant observation, and public policy analysis). In view of the climate imperative and related environmental challenges, DEMETRA seeks to provide tools for a democratic governance of sustainability transformation.
project.title: Democratic Governance, Environmental and Climate Challenges, and Societal Transformation: Deliberation, Inclusiveness, and Citizen Empowerment for Sustainable Food Systems
project.keywords: democratic governance, climate and sustainability transitions, deliberative participatory processes, citizen engagement, inclusiveness, empowerment

result.title: Guidelines for the empirical analyses
result.description: A conceptualization of the notion of a DPP relevant to the assessment of food policy in general and the FFS strategy in particular. This will involve a detailed presentation of the operationalization of our key independent and dependent variables for the study of DPPs.

result.title: Questionnaire for the online survey
result.description: Codebook for the analysis of websites including questions about the organizations’ goals, structure, membership, territorial scope, location, activities, and local/international networks (English version).

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 1 - DEMETRA (Democratic Governance, Environmental and Climate Challenges, and Societal Transformation:Deliberation, Inclusiveness, and Citizen Empowerment for Sustainable Food Systems)
result.teaser: DEMETRA addresses one of the most urgent challenges of our time: how to govern the transformation towards sustainability in a democratic, inclusive, and effective way. DEMETRA seeks to contribute to the development of effective, egalitarian, and democratic forms of citizen...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

result.title: Integrated report on organizational analysis
result.description: Report, based on national reports, summarizing the main findings of WP3. The report will consist of a comparative assessment of results from the online survey based on inputs from the national teams.

result.title: Report of existing studies and data
result.description: Report summarizing the existing studies and freely available data-sources about citizens’ experiences of deliberative discussions, their willingness to deliberate, and their capacity for political deliberation and attitudes towards sustainable food systems in each country as well as at the EU level.

result.title: Questionnaire for the semi-structured interviews
result.description: Semi-structured questionnaire (English version) for the interviews with political representatives involved in food policy on the city-level, including questions relating to the experience with, and perception of, different forms of participative and deliberative processes, their successes and failures, and the background conditions to influence these processes.

result.title: List of sources and survey items
result.description: List of existing survey items/sources that can be used to measure DPPs and support for sustainable food systems

result.title: Guidelines for analyses of existing survey data
result.description: Guidelines for collecting and analyzing national information about survey items used to measure both DPPs and sustainable food systems.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
